{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.11194v1", "title": "Two-Part Forecasting for Time-Shifted Metrics", "summary": "Katz, Savage, and Brusch propose a two-part forecasting method for sectors
where event timing differs from recording time. They treat forecasting as a
time-shift operation, using univariate time series for total bookings and a
Bayesian Dirichlet Auto-Regressive Moving Average (B-DARMA) model to allocate
bookings across trip dates based on lead time. Analysis of Airbnb data shows
that this approach is interpretable, flexible, and potentially more accurate
for forecasting demand across multiple time axes.", "main_category": "stat.AP", "categories": "stat.AP", "published": "2025-04-15T13:49:23Z"}
